statement: The consolidated performance of the Company and its subsidiaries has shown significant growth.
Revenue increased by 32% CAGR over the past financial years.
Profit after tax grew by 45% CAGR, reflecting strong financial health.
The Company has a strong market presence with nearly 100% servicing of online orders from stores.
The Westside brand registered a 49% like-for-like growth in sales in FY23.
The Company faced an adverse impact of `104 Crore due to the adoption of IndAS 116 accounting standard.
The total comprehensive loss for the year was `44 Crore.
There were instances of significant legal disputes regarding service tax on renting of immovable property.
The Company aims to accelerate growth by addressing market opportunities and enhancing product propositions.
Future strategies include improving efficiencies in the supply chain and reducing emissions per garment shipped.
The Company faces risks related to cybersecurity and data privacy, which could lead to reputational damage.
There are scalability risks due to limited availability of quality real estate and high rentals.
The Company is exposed to foreign currency risk through purchases from overseas parties.
